title: Sine and Cosine - finding values from coordinates

content.question: In the <math alttext="x y"><semantics><mrow><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>-plane, the terminal ray of angle <math alttext="theta"><semantics><mi>θ</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> in standard position intersects a circle of radius <math alttext="r"><semantics><mi>r</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> at the point <math alttext="open parentheses 10 comma negative 10 square root of 3 close parentheses"><semantics><mfenced><mrow><mn>10</mn><mo>,</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>10</mn><msqrt><mn>3</mn></msqrt></mrow></mfenced><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>. What are the values of <math alttext="theta"><semantics><mi>θ</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> and <math alttext="r"><semantics><mi>r</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> ?

choices.label: ​​<math alttext="theta equals fraction numerator 5 pi over denominator 3 end fraction"><semantics><mrow><mi>θ</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>5</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mn>3</mn></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> and <math alttext="r equals 10"><semantics><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="theta equals fraction numerator 5 pi over denominator 3 end fraction"><semantics><mrow><mi>θ</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>5</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mn>3</mn></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> and <math alttext="r equals 20"><semantics><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>20</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​​<math alttext="theta equals fraction numerator 11 pi over denominator 6 end fraction"><semantics><mrow><mi>θ</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>11</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mn>6</mn></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> and <math alttext="r equals 10"><semantics><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​​<math alttext="theta equals fraction numerator 11 pi over denominator 6 end fraction"><semantics><mrow><mi>θ</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>11</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mn>6</mn></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> and <math alttext="r equals 20"><semantics><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>20</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

content.answer: ​<math alttext="theta equals fraction numerator 5 pi over denominator 3 end fraction"><semantics><mrow><mi>θ</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>5</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mn>3</mn></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> and <math alttext="r equals 20"><semantics><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>20</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Apply numerical results in a given mathematical or applied context.
